data.name: TextBox1.Text
data.value:
VooDoo GEN1 Data Logger (v1.0, 2023).
Requirements: O2 Sensor: Currently the only supported sensor is the AEM UEGO 30-4110. To plug this sensor into a usb, an RS232 to usb device will be required. If you want to use another sensor, some work could be done to get it integrated. I use the UEGO on all my stuff, so it's the only one I had sitting around to integrate.
Engine Communication: Boost by Smith Gen 1 Flashing device: (https://boostbysmith.com/shop/suzuki-hayabusa-02-07-ecu-flashing-interface/)
Comm Ports: The devices will need to be plugged in prior to starting the program due to the ports being polled on startup. This means that if you connect the devices after launching the program, the comm port will not be shown as available.
General Use: With the comm ports set, click "Data ON". Then cycle ignition power as necessary to sync up data (just like ecu editor, cycle key power until the data syncs and is displayed). Once data is syncronized, start the engine. Ensure that the IAP/TPS switching point matches the tune that is being used (the default is the stock suzuki setting). If this setting is inaccurate, then the map shown as current will not be correct (and data saved and then read into the associated tuning spread sheet will not be sorted correctly). You can load a previous log file to continue adding log data to it by pressing the "Load Log Data" button and selecting the file. Following the loading, the tables should populate with the previously logged data. The TPS/IAP switching point will update to the one used when the log file was saved.
At this time I am having issues with the grid views that show the logged data in real time. If you are experiencing issues, I recommend leaving the MAP Display Toggle on "None" due to the other settings potentially endusing lag. To combat this issue, the button that changes what is displayed is disabled when data logging. To change the display, stop logging and cycle the display button to the desired display, and then start logging again. You will notice that cycling the display will cause interuptions to the data stream.The map views will not be updated until data logging is enable by clicking "Start Logging". Once data has been logged, a button to save the data will appear. This will save the data into a comma deliminated file (.csv) that can easily be viewed in excel and is formated for use with the associated excel macro enabled file ("Tuning Sheet v2.0.xlsm").
Currently, the only data validation that occurs is based on the RPM value read being >500 and the Ambient pressure being >150 and <230. As I use the tool I will continue to look for ways to vette the data being read prior to writing it to the data log.
